job description:
• *At Golder, we thrive on challenges.**
  • *Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.**
Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for a **Project Environmental Scientist** to join our **Denver** team on a **full time** basis.
  • *An overview of your role will include:**
+ Provide technical environmental science services for a range of projects in mining, water resources management, and environmental sustainability.

+ Work under the direction of Environmental Managers and Engineers.

+ Develop environmental sustainability plans and project life cycles for client operations and activities.

+ Monitor environmental impacts of industrial and mining activities.

+ Duties will include collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data.

+ Assist in preparation of data summaries, charts, graphs, and writing analytical reports.

+ Use technical software such as GoldSET to perform environmental sustainability studies for mining and industrial projects.

+ Support stakeholder engagement for a collaborative platform for consultation and communication of results.

+ Identify stakeholders and develop influence/interest matrices.

+ Develop and maintain stakeholder relationships, implement engagement and support strategies, and manage stakeholder satisfaction.

+ Implement project controls and evaluate project performance using established standards and milestones during design and construction of environmentally sensitive projects.

+ Utilize STATA to perform financial analyses and budget tracking
  • *You will have a background in:**
+ **Master?s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Environmental Studies or Environmental Sustainability and 2 years of experience in the job offered or in project management related to environmental sustainability.**

+ **All stated experience must include the following:**

+ **Using Life Cycle Assessment software, including GaBi, TRACI 2.1 or SimaPro;**

+ **Leading large, multi-disciplinary teams to schedule and budget, and mentor employees;**

+ **Performing integrated change control, identifying and mitigating risks, managing stakeholder expectations, and managing quality of services provided;**

+ **Experience with international standards on sustainability management and sustainability metrics reporting (Global Reporting Initiative Index; Energy Sustainability Index; Environmental Sustainability Index; ISO); and**

+ **managing document production lines to deliver technical reports and memoranda to internal and client standards.**

+ **1 year of stated experience must include the following:**

+ **Performing options analysis for decision-support systems for large-scale projects, including stakeholder engagement;**

+ **Planning, managing, and completing Environmental Social Impact Assessments;**

+ **Experience with project management to globally recognized standards set by the Project Management Institute;**

+ **Experience in coordinating internal and external stakeholder engagement for permitting and approvals; and**

+ **statistical approaches in financial planning, including implementation of statistical computing programs such as STATA** **.**
  • *Your benefits at Golder will include:**
+ **Competitive benefits and remuneration packages**

+ **Option to purchase shares in Golder**

+ **Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result**

+ **Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment**

+ **Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects**

+ **On the job training, mentoring and coaching**

+ **Global projects and travel opportunities**
  • *Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 40 countries, Golder?s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.**
